tr.td: The number of milliseconds that IO operations have spent queued or being serviced since the system booted. Tracking the rate of change of this metric can give an indication of how many operations are typically queued or being serviced during the sampling interval.
Approximate current size of the IO operation queue.
The number of bytes read from the disk.
The number of read operations performed.
The amount of time, in milliseconds, spent reading.
Average time, in millseconds, required to service recent IO operations.
Total number of millseconds spent servicing IO operations.
The amount of time, in milliseconds, spent writing
